revised_title: Extreme Heat in Georgia: Observations and Implications
tldr: The author, Henry Ellis, describes the extreme heat in Georgia, reporting temperatures of up to 102 degrees Fahrenheit in the shade. He discusses the effects of the heat on the local population and the potential for hurricanes. Ellis also compares the heat in Georgia to other climates he has experienced, such as Africa and the West Indies, and notes the impact of sudden temperature changes on the human body.
